alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 6:57PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western McDonough and Hancock Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ferris, or 7 miles northwest of Carthage, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ferris, Adrian and Colusa around 705 PM CDT. Carthage and Burnside around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tennessee and Colmar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
